frameDefinitions: A group of Arguers (also expressible as Arguer1 and Arguer2) express incompatible opinions or beliefs about an Issue.
An Agent performs an Action incorrectly.
An Agent goes to an Event and is present in a relatively non-participatory way.
A Communicator communicates a judgment of an Evaluee to an Addressee.
A generally large group of people, the Combatants, are engaged in a chaotic, violent, and usually protracted Fight amongst themselves.
Unless a particular Required_situation obtains, Negative_consequences will follow.
frameExamples: We <t>bickered</t> about semantics for an hour.
The Angolan guerrillas will <t>attend</t> a September meeting in Zaire.
I <t>commended</t> his handling of the crisis.
You <t>must</t> turn in your test by 5 p.m.
listRoleDefinitions: A group of people in an argument.
A person who is arguing with Arguer2.
The person who is being argued with by <fen>Arguer1</fen>.
The the thing the the <fen>Arguers</fen> are arguing over or about.
The time when the argument takes place.
The location at which the <fen>Arguers</fen> quarrel
The <fen>Agent</fen> performs an action incorrectly.
<fen>Patient</fen> is the entity affected by the <fen>Agent</fen>'s bungling of an <fen>Action</fen>.
This role identifies the <fen>Action</fen> that the <fen>Agent</fen> performs incorrectly.
The type of action that the <fen>Agent</fen> habitually bungles.
This role identifies the <fen>Time</fen> when the bungling occurs.
This role identifies the <fen>Place</fen> where the bungling occurs.
The  <fen>Agent</fen> is the person who chooses to make himself present at the <fen>Event</fen>.
The <fen>Event</fen> is the deliberate set of happenings given at a particular time and place.
When the <fen>Agent</fen> attends the <fen>Event</fen>.
The location where the <fen>Agent</fen> attends the <fen>Event</fen>.
The <fen>Communicator</fen> uses language in the written or spoken modality to convey his or her evaluation of the <fen>Evaluee</fen> to another person.
<fen>Medium</fen> identifies the physical or abstract setting in which the evaluation is conveyed.
<fen>Topic</fen> identifies the entity to which the proposition or propositions conveyed relate.
A judgment is made about the <fen>Evaluee</fen>  With verbs this role is typically expressed as Object:
<fen>Expressor</fen> is the body part or action by a body part that conveys the judgment made by the <fen>Communicator</fen>.
Typically, there is a constituent expressing the <t>Reason</t> for the <fen>Communicator</fen>'s judgment. It is usually a <ment>for</ment>-PP.
When the communication of the judgment takes place.
Where the communication of the judgment takes place.
The <fen>Combatants</fen> participate as fighters in the <fen>Fight</fen>.
The violent activity.
When the <fen>Fight</fen> takes place.
Where the <fen>Fight</fen> takes place.
The state-of-affairs which prevents <fen>Negative_consequences</fen>.
The period during which the <fen>Required_situation</fen> is necessary to prevent negative consequences.
The location within which the <fen>Required_situation</fen> is required.
listRoleExamples: The Austro-Hungarian Empire had a long history of <fex>military</fex> screw-ups.
Jon criticized Madie <fex>about her managerial style</fex>.
She viewed him with a critical <fex>gaze</fex>.
He was belittled by his long-time friend <fex>in front of his family</fex>.
The football referee's controversial call led to a bloody free-for-all <fex>among the fans</fex>.
I couldn't help but watch as several bruised people reentered the <fex><t>melee</t></fex>.
He was told that <fex>when he got back</fex> , his column needed a serious rethink .
<fex>In California</fex> , seatbelts must be fastened at all times .

passageCandidateSpans.text: Ponzi Scheme - How the Scandal Affected His Family, Ruth, Mark & Andrew
